intro: Velaea tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Velaea tenuifolia is known for its hairy stems and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
